issues.title: Iris_0.2.0 still has recording line error with new openBrowser
issues.body:
After downloading and building Iris_0.2.0 source when I run it with java -jar Iris_0.1.0\* I get the following error:

```
C:\Iris\build\jar>java -jar Iris_0.1.0.jar
IRIS VOICE AUTOMATION - Created by Samir Ahmed 2011
 Please visit http://www.samir-ahmed.com/ for more information
 To report issues please go to https://www.github.com/samirahmed

unable to get a recording line
javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException: line with format PCM_SIGNED 1
6000.0 Hz, 16 bit, stereo, 4 bytes/frame, little-endian not supported.

        at com.sun.media.sound.DirectAudioDevice$DirectDL.implOpen(Unknown Source)
        at com.sun.media.sound.AbstractDataLine.open(Unknown Source)
        at com.sun.media.sound.AbstractDataLine.open(Unknown Source)
        at com.samir_ahmed.Iris.Recorder.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.samir_ahmed.Iris.Recognizer.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.samir_ahmed.Iris.Iris.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.samir_ahmed.Iris.Iris.main(Unknown Source)
```

I compiled and ran  it using the 64-bit 1.7.0_2 JDK on a Win7 64 bit OS

*I forked the build.xml file and submitted the changes so that ant will build the proper version name.

commits.message: Fixed build.xml so that when Ant builds the jar the file is named it's proper version, Iris_0.2.0, instead of previous version, Iris_0.1.0.

issue_comments.body: Thanks, I'll look into this and get back to you.

> PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 16 bit, stereo, 4 bytes/frame, little-endian

It would seem that your card does support 'little-endian', perhaps you need to change some of your audio settings in order to run the program first.

issues.title: Iris Additions
issues.body:
Does anybody have any suggestions on what would be a cool module to add to Iris?

I was thinking,
- Gmail Checking and Unread Email Briefing
- Google Calendar Integration
- Onboard Sphinx4 speech recognition to allow for it to be activated and respond without having a single click
- Twitter Checking
- New York Times Headlines.

Let me know if what you think would be useful. I will try and work on those aspects of it and obviously anybody can hack away at them too.

Cheers

Samir

commits.message:
Merge pull request #6 from lordbunson/patch-1

Fixed build.xml version number.

Merge pull request #3 from gragtah/iris-0.2

Iris 0.2 - Corrected Windows System Call
Updated readme's -how to build- section... again
rewrote the how to build section of readme to encorporate rayjonwilson's new ant build
added link to binary in readme
Included a zip file with all jars necessary for building sucessfully
Restructured for pure console based application / Cleaned up the console output

issue_comments.body:
Hey rayjanwilson,

First off, I think its awesome that you are interested in Iris, thanks for taking time to look at it and even better try and fix it

I have no experience with any, and I am a little bit confused with how to build my project with it, before I merge the pull request, could you give me a hand explaining how to build the file from scratch with ant.

As soon as i figure out how to do it I will merge them, I just want to make sure that you have build it and it is possible.

Sorry for the hesitation,
Thanks again, I am really excited to see people interested,

Cheers

Samir

I made a new branch iris-0.2
and pulled your forked repo into it

I amended the readme
which incorporates your the restructured build

Only thing is that the way I have the resources setup,
it is necessary to copy the res/ main/ and lib/  directories into the build/jar/ folder so that they can all be accessed when we run the jar

Thanks for helping me work with this on ant.

I dont know how to change the directory name to iris_0.2.0 if it is possible but i havent figured it out.

Since this is on a new branch, its no problem if i close this original pull request to branch master? 

Just so you know your input is really appreciated and it would be awesome if you could keep hacking on  Iris on this branch! Any ideas, feedback and additions would be great!

Thanks again!

Samir

check the openbrowser.java file,
I have never run it on windows.

ensure that the external command to open a the default browser works,
there might be a main static function for the main openbrowser.java  so that you can test it.

Let me know how it goes
if managed to fix it you can submit a pull request

Regarding Calendar Integration - Should I just have the user enter google account information on start up? Or is it better to use OAuth, I alway feel like OAuth is too complicated.
- I think i might do the NY Times top headlines next.

Looking at the stack trace and error report, it seems like your sound card doesn't  support the audio format listed there.

Unfortunately, some of those requirements (16bit/16Khz/4byte frames) are required by Google's Voice to Text API.

after some googling i determined that there is a way to determine what your sound card can support

taken from

http://amug.org/~glguerin/other/index.html  ... AboutSound

you can compile and run the AboutSound.java file 

it shoots out a response regarding what your audio card can support.

thats as much as I know about the topic, if you can figure out a way to record in a more standard way and covert it to the current format, I presume that could be a solution too

commits.message: Fixed browser open command for windows

issue_comments.body:
Well, this was in windows. Using gitbash. However, it seems to work in cmd, but still fails for processes like when it tries to bring up google search etc.
Will try running it in ubuntu/os X.
Comments?

I think we should incorporate ChaCha.com too - it provides answers to a lot of questions people ask.

API here: http://developer.chacha.com/The_ChaCha_APIs
Let's just do the enter account info method for now, unless you've already started OAuth

commits.message: trying to clear these deleted files
cleaned up the build.xml and file locations for building from commandline

issue_comments.body:
hey samir,

go ahead and clone the fork from my repo before merging

to build you just run
'ant jar'

and it will roll through it. the jar will be located in
build/jar/Iris_0.1.0.jar

then cd into build/jar and type 'java -jar Iris_0.1.0.jar'

build.xml changes:
- in the properies, i made the build, lib, src, classes, and jar
  directories variables
  - that way you can reference ${jar.dir} instead of build/jar/
- changed the build target 'build' to compile
- changed the compile destination directory from build/ to build/classes/
- added the jar target for ant to construct a jar file
- cleaned out the excludes since those files aren't present anyways
- cleaned out run targets for individual modules, like Recorder

here's the other things i changed:
- location of the dependency libs because when i unpacked the libs.zip it
  put them in lib/lib.
- location of the src files from being deeply nested under src/ to be
  directly in src/

these changes may mess up your eclipse project though.

let me know how it goes =)
-rayjan

Would translation be something of interest? Google translate can take in voice input and return a synthesized translation.

I am having the same issue. I get 

unable to get a recording line
javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException: line with format PCM_SIGNED 1
6000.0 Hz, 16 bit, stereo, 4 bytes/frame, little-endian not supported.

But is it really because of the sound card? Could it be because of some other reason?

I got the supported formats using AboutSound and, for example, I got this:
     ...
      PCM_UNSIGNED unknown sample rate, 8 bit, mono, 1 bytes/frame, 
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 8 bit, mono, 1 bytes/frame, 
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 16 bit, mono, 2 bytes/frame, little-endian
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 16 bit, mono, 2 bytes/frame, big-endian
      PCM_UNSIGNED unknown sample rate, 8 bit, stereo, 2 bytes/frame, 
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 8 bit, stereo, 2 bytes/frame, 
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 16 bit, stereo, 4 bytes/frame, little-endian
      PCM_SIGNED unknown sample rate, 16 bit, stereo, 4 bytes/frame, big-endian
       ...

I didn't got any value for sample rate.
Thanks a lot for your answer. What settings do you mean? Can you help me with this?
